So far I only see ETF on Nikko AM STI ETF. Is there any ETF for US indicies (e.g S&P 500) or other overseas indicies?4 answersAnswerBump1

Today I use interactive brokers to purchase overseas ETFs as it's much more affordable than local brokerages. You can DCA into a few overseas ETFs each month using this platform. The cost is so low ($1 per trade?) that you'd probably be paying the minimum $10 a month charge. 3 comments4

Jonathan Chia Guangrong, Fund Manager at JCG FundLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 17 Jan 2019SPY would be a popular and highly liquid ETF for the S&P500, and quite cheap at 0.09% fees a year. That said, there is really no automatic way to dca into this or any specific Etf on a monthly basis. You will need to manually make the purchase through platforms like Td Ameritrade or interactive brokers. Avoid the local brokers as mentioned by Adam below as the fees are not worth it. Alternatively you can consider the robo advisory platforms but you won't be able to choose your Etf as it's portfolio based. Hope this helps 0 comments1
